articles.title: Tim Scott & John Kennedy Bring Bank Secrecy Act Into The 21st Century
articles.author: John Tamny
articles.summary: Sens. Tim Scott and John Kennedy have introduced the Streamlining Transaction Reporting and Ensuring Anti-Money Laundering Improvements for a New Era Act, which will modernize 1970 banking legislation defined by a clear lack of strict economy. In 1970 the Bank Secrecy Act was passed. It required financial institutions to generate transaction reports for cash transactions north of $10,000 and suspicious activity reports for $2,000 to $5,000 depending on the circumstances. In the present day $10k transactions are much more common than they were in the 1970s. The Act will increase the reporting threshold from $10K to $30K.
